channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: In last meetings with Children’s Aid Society, boy was crying, thin. He died months later, Ontario trial told
item.description: In September 2022, an adoption worker wrote down her concerns about the boy’s apparent thinness, paleness and sunken cheeks, but no subsequent followup visit happened before he died at age 12 on Dec. 21 while under the care of a Burlington, Ont., couple.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: B.C. premier says his province will not be running planned anti-tariff ads
item.description: Following a forestry summit with federal Minister responsible for Canada-U.S. Trade Dominic LeBlanc, Premier David Eby said British Columbia will not run anti-tariff advertisements on its own, as it had planned. He said when the time comes to speak to Americans, it will be in partnership with the federal government.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Can the federal budget reset Canada's economy?
item.description: Canada's economy is suffering. The Bank of Canada says interest rate cuts can only do so much. So it's passed the baton to the federal government. This week's budget can do what the central bank cannot: restructure how the Canadian economy grows.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Flights from Canada to U.S. fell in September, but spiked elsewhere: data
item.description: New data shows the number of passengers screened in Canadian airports was much higher for domestic and abroad destinations — but not the United States.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Bloc Québécois candidate who lost by 1 vote in federal election plans appeal to Supreme Court
item.description: A Bloc Québécois candidate said Monday she is appealing to the Supreme Court to request a new election in the Montreal-area riding of Terrebonne, won by the federal Liberals in April by a single vote.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: B.C. won't launch anti-tariff U.S. ads until ‘aligned' with Ottawa: premier
item.description: Eby said the ads, which were meant to protest U.S. tariffs on softwood lumber, were raised during a meeting on the future of the forestry sector with federal government ministers.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 25 players to represent Canada at key Olympic women's hockey tune-up games
item.description: Canada's four-game Rivalry Series against the U.S. begins this week with games in Cleveland , Ohio and Buffalo, N.Y. They'll play two more games in December, as Hockey Canada prepares to name the team that will represent Canada at the Olympics in Italy in February.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canada will start dispute resolution process over Stellantis jobs lost to U.S., Joly says
item.description: Industry Minister Melanie Joly told a parliamentary committee Monday that Ottawa wants to recover some of the billions it has committed to auto manufacturer Stellantis.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Carney asked Ford 'a couple of times' to pull anti-tariff ad, Ont. premier says
item.description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford says Prime Minister Mark Carney called him "a couple of times" from Asia to ask him to pull an ad campaign that's being blamed for ending trade talks with the United States.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: B.C. coroner reports 158 toxic drug deaths in September, 19% drop from 2024
item.description: The BC Coroners Service says in a statement that fentanyl or its analogs were found in the system of 84 per cent of those who were tested.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Donald Trump’s regime change plan for Venezuela spells bad news for Alberta’s oilsands
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Carly Rae Jepsen announces pregnancy
item.description: Canadian singer-songwriter Carly Rae Jepsen is expecting her first child with her new husband, music producer Cole M.G.N.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ottawa rejects $28K raise for federal judges, citing tariffs and defence spending
item.description: The federal government has rejected judicial salary recommendations from an independent body seeking a $28,000 raise for federal judges.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Adds 323 Beds to Reduce Wait Times
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ontario wildfires burned almost 6,000 square kilometres this year
item.description: The Ontario government says 643 wildfires were recorded between April and October, with almost 6,000 square kilometres burned in 2025.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ex-Bloc MP will appeal to Supreme Court after losing seat by single vote
item.description: A former Bloc MP who lost her riding in the federal election by a single is taking the matter to court after hearing from a voter about a returned ballot.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Say Hi to Tech Bro Carney
item.description: As his government heedlessly embraces artificial intelligence, the threats to Canadians are clear.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Liberals scrapping 2 billion trees target as part of budget: sources
item.description: The Liberal government is dropping its goal to plant two billion trees by 2031 as part of Tuesday's budget, according to sources familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Calgary firefighters warn against single-stair apartments as trend spreads to Canadian cities
item.description: Calgary’s firefighters union is trying to prevent what it calls a dangerous housing trend — in which multi-storey housing buildings are being constructed with only one stairwell — from making its way here.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Toronto police cruiser ‘inadvertently' rolls onto tasered suspect, officer
item.description: A video circulating online appears to show an officer pointing a taser at a suspect in a parking lot near a Tim Hortons before firing it, as the suspect falls to the ground.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Kingston’s Toys for Tickets program returns for the holiday season
item.description: Kingston’s Toys for Tickets program lets drivers donate toys instead of paying parking fines from Nov. 1 to Dec. 3, helping local children during the holidays.

item.title: Kidnapper admits to beating, waterboarding ‘Crypto King’ Aiden Pleterski
item.description: Self-proclaimed “Crypto King” Aiden Pleterski was on his knees begging for his life while his kidnapper pointed a gun at him and counted down from three.

item.title: What will the Carney government's 1st budget include? Here are some hints
item.description: Finance Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne will present the budget on Tuesday, with experts projecting the government’s deficit skyrocketing this year.

item.title: A farmer, her flock, and the North they sustain
item.description: In B.C’s North Coast, Kieran McKeown, a third-generation farmer, blends innovation, integrity, and community spirit to feed a region and keep her family’s legacy alive.

item.title: Glitch Theatre debuts with neurodivergent-led premiere
item.description: New name, new mandate, and a neurodivergent-led creative team define the company’s 2025 launch.

item.title: Suki’s: Fifty-four years of style, education, and legacy
item.description: For 54 years, Suki’s has shaped Vancouver’s hair culture through artistry and education. Named Best Salon in the Georgia Straight’s Best of Vancouver 2025, the iconic brand continues to set the standard for innovation, collaboration, and timeless style—from its world-class Academy to its visionary team.
